climbs.name: Tom Dennis
climbs.fa: Sean Gallup, Richard Rossiter, Gino Gornnert, 2001.

content.description:
Start about 15 feet left of Into The Mystic at a hand crack in a left-facing corner.  Climb the crack, and a narrower crack above, to a ledge at the base of the final slab.  Continuing straight up looked unappealing.  I placed marginal  blue and black Aliens and looked at the lichen-covered, runout seam up the slab and opted to traverse right and finish with the last two bolts on Into The Mystic.  Continue to the main ledge and belay at the 2-bolt anchor atop Into The Mystic.

The route is 95 feet long; rappel back to the start with a 60m rope.

This route gets a bomb rating because there just isn't enough good climbing on it.  The lower crack is OK, but the upper slab doesn't look worth the trouble.
content.protection: Finger and hand-sized pro for the lower crack; small Aliens for the upper slab.  2-bolt anchor at the top, shared with Into The Mystic.

content.description:
As suggested by Ivan, among others.

Start on Ledge One, above and right of a set of stone steps on the Sleeping Beauty approach trail. Link the route

Into the Mystic

with

Mystic Mile

for a three pitch tour of Sleeping Beauty. A very convenient and surprisingly good 280 feet of sport climbing!
content.protection: A dozen draws, plus something for the bolted belays.

climbs.name: Into the Mystic
climbs.fa: Richard Rossiter, Raoul Rossiter, Steve Bartlett, 2000

content.description:
Into the Mystic starts from "Ledge One", which is just right of some stone steps at the second steep bit on the trail along the base. As a further reference (I missed Ledge One the first time), high on the upper wall, directly above the stone steps, is a prominent double tree. The climb starts about 20 feet right of the trail at a cluster of trees. A tricky move off the ground followed by moderate climbing leads to the third bolt and two hard moves with a good rest in between. Easy slabs lead the rest of the way to "Ledge Two". Continue on

Mystic Mile

(10c) for a total of 3 pitches of 10 sport. A decent climb with some good moves, but the upper half is real easy.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a two bolt anchor with rings.
